channel.title: NYT > World
channel.copyright: Copyright 2013 The New York Times Company

item.title: The Lede: Tracking the Syrian Crisis
item.description: The Times is providing updates, analysis and public reaction from around the world.
item.dc:creator: By THE NEW YORK TIMES

item.title: At War Blog: Lasting Lessons of a Rosh Hashana Amid a Naval Buildup
item.description: As tensions flared in the Middle East, the mission was to perform a symbolic ritual in Kuwait on the first day of the Jewish year.
item.dc:creator: By DAVID FROMMER
item.media:description: David Frommer leading a Rosh Hashana service at Camp Arifjan in Kuwait, in May 2012.

item.title: Lens Blog: A Veteran Reporter Reflects on a Distant War
item.description: On the eve of a book and exhibits about the Vietnam War culled from Associated Press archives, Ralph Blumenthal reflects on covering the conflict’s early years.
item.dc:creator: By RALPH BLUMENTHAL

item.title: Images of the Vietnam War That Defined an Era
item.description: A retrospective book and exhibitions highlight war photographs that turned the tide of public opinion.
item.dc:creator: By RALPH BLUMENTHAL
item.media:description: In a 1968 Associated Press photo from Vietnam by Art Greenspon, a soldier guides an unseen medevac helicopter to a jungle clearing where wounded comrades wait.

item.title: Split Senate Panel Approves Giving Obama Limited Authority on Syria
item.description: The 10-to-7 vote in the Foreign Relations Committee sets up a showdown next week in the full Senate on whether President Obama should be given the power to strike Syria.
item.dc:creator: By MARK LANDLER, JONATHAN WEISMAN and MICHAEL R. GORDON
item.media:description: Rebels with the Free Syrian Army wore gas masks on Wednesday inside a house during an offensive against President Bashar al-Assad’s forces in northern Syria.

item.title: The Lede: Rumsfeld Derides Obama as ‘the So-Called Commander in Chief’
item.description: In speeches and television interviews, the former defense secretary has made frequent remarks about President Obama’s response to the use of chemical weapons against Syrian civilians.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By CHRISTINE HAUSER

item.title: The Lede: On Assad’s Social Media Accounts, an Effort to Project Calm
item.description: Syria’s president has sought to project an air of normalcy on social media, though the terrain has been largely dominated by the rebel brigades and activist groups that oppose him.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By LIAM STACK

item.title: Obama in Russia to Meet World Leaders Amid Syria Tension
item.description: President Obama is in Russia for an international summit meeting officially focused on economics but unofficially absorbed by America’s looming confrontation with Syria.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By PETER BAKER
item.media:description: President Obama met with President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia on Thursday during the G-20 summit in St. Petersburg, Russia.

item.title: The Lede: Looking at Syria and Seeing Bosnia, Not Iraq
item.description: Some supporters of military intervention in Syria argue that there might be more to learn from the United States-led bombing campaign that helped to end the brutal sectarian civil war in Bosnia in 1995 than from the American invasion of Iraq in 2003.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By ROBERT MACKEY

item.title: Egypt’s Interior Minister Survives Attack
item.description: Egyptian security officials said Mohamed Ibrahim survived an assassination attempt on Thursday after an explosive device detonated near his convoy.
item.dc:creator: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK and MAYY EL SHEIKH

item.title: Letter From Europe: Syria Crisis Reveals New Paradigm
item.description: The balance in many nations between politics at home and the ability to project military power abroad seems to have shifted into a new and more circumspect era.
item.dc:creator: By ALAN COWELL

item.title: India Ink: Falling Rupee Puts Brakes on India’s Auto Industry
item.description: The auto industry has been hit by sluggish domestic demand as economic growth slows, and costs of imported auto components rise with the rupee’s depreciation.
item.dc:creator: By MALAVIKA VYAWAHARE
item.media:description: Renault cars parked at the company stockyard on the outskirts of Ahmedabad, Gujarat, on June 11.

item.title: Chinese Official, a Symbol of Greed and Corruption, Is Sentenced
item.description: The former provincial safety official Yang Dacai became known as Brother Watch for his penchant for wearing expensive wristwatches, a habit publicized by Chinese microbloggers.
item.dc:creator: By NEIL GOUGH

item.title: India Ink: India’s ‘Cyberabad’ Smiles as the Rupee Falls
item.description: Profits grow for software entrepreneurs in Hyderabad, Andhra Pradesh, as the Indian rupee falls.
item.dc:creator: By SRIRAM KARRI
item.media:description: A photo illustration showing a U.S. Dollar note and Indian rupee coins in Bangalore, Karnataka, on Aug. 29.

item.title: Brutality of Syrian Rebels Posing Dilemma in West
item.description: Many Syrian rebels have adopted some of the chillingly ruthless tactics of the government, raising the prospect that a military strike could strengthen extremists.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By C. J. CHIVERS

item.title: British Soldiers Charged in Assault of Off-Duty Police Officer
item.description: Six British soldiers got into a fight outside a bar on the East Side, the police said. They face the prospect of short jail terms and possibly discharge from the army, officials said.
item.dc:creator: By MICHAEL SCHWIRTZ

item.title: Op-Ed Contributors: What Sir William Would Do in Syria
item.description: Intervention in Syria without a political plan for peace is folly.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.dc:creator: By ALEX DE WAAL and BRIDGET CONLEY-ZILKIC

item.title: World Briefing | Europe: German President Attends World War II Ceremony in France
item.description: President Joachim Gauck and President François Hollande of France joined hands on Wednesday in a ceremony commemorating the massacre of Oradour-sur-Glane, in central France, by Nazis.
item.category: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
item.dc:creator: By MAÏA de la BAUME
item.media:description: President François Hollande of France, left, and President Joachim Gauck of Germany, right, with Robert Hébras, a survivor of a 1944 Nazi massacre.

item.title: World Briefing | The Americas: Vatican Removes Its Envoy to Dominican Republic
item.description: After the papal envoy was abruptly recalled from his post by the Vatican, the authorities in the Dominican Republic said they would look into rumors of child sexual abuse.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing | Africa: Mali: New President Takes Office
item.description: Ibrahim Boubacar Keita took the oath of office on Wednesday, promising to help unify the country after a rebellion, a coup and an Islamic insurgency.
item.category: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing | Asia: I.M.F. Approves $6.7 Billion Loan for Pakistan
item.description: The International Monetary Fund’s board approved the loan package on Wednesday to help the nation revive its ailing economy.
item.dc:creator: By REUTERS

item.title: Op-Ed Columnist: The Era of Disbelief
item.description: This time, Americans are questioning everything — as they should.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.dc:creator: By CHARLES M. BLOW

item.title: New Generation of Jewish Sect Takes Up Struggle to Protect Place in Modern Israel
item.description: Karaite Jews, who split from rabbinical Judaism more than 1,000 years ago, say that the Orthodox authorities have tried to subsume them into the rabbinical mainstream.
item.dc:creator: By ISABEL KERSHNER
item.media:credit: Rina Castelnuovo for The New York Times
item.media:description: Karaite Jews, who split from rabbinical Judaism more than 1,000 years ago, prayed at a synagogue in Ramla, Israel.

item.title: Op-Ed Columnist: The Right Questions on Syria
item.description: Sitting on our hands as Syrians are slaughtered is not “pro-peace.”
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.dc:creator: By NICHOLAS D. KRISTOF

item.title: Mexico Passes a Weakened Bill to Evaluate Teachers
item.description: For the first time, teachers would undergo mandatory evaluations, for example, but analysts said violent protests had led Congress to include provisions that might undermine the new legislation.
item.dc:creator: By KARLA ZABLUDOVSKY
item.media:description: A teacher from southern Mexico protested in Mexico City on Wednesday against legislation to overhaul education.
